definition: Electrical or mechanical devices designed for specific household tasks, especially cooking and food preparation.

positive_examples: She used the blender to make a smoothie for breakfast.
The slow cooker had been simmering the stew all day.
He plugged in the electric can opener to open the tomatoes.
The bread machine kneaded the dough automatically.
They grilled vegetables on the outdoor barbecue.
The pressure cooker reduced the cooking time significantly.
negative_examples: She used a sharp knife to chop the vegetables.
The wooden spoon stirred the soup gently.
He opened the can with a manual can opener.
The cast iron pan heated evenly on the stove.
She measured flour using metal measuring cups.
The ceramic bowl held the mixed ingredients.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Tool, Instrument, Machine, Equipment

opposite_reasoning: NaturalObject provides the strongest and most semantically coherent opposition to Appliances. The artifact↔natural distinction is fundamental in ontology and creates clear separation: Appliances are human-designed, manufactured devices with specific functions, while NaturalObjects exist without human intervention or design intent. This opposition is widely recognized in both WordNet and SUMO, making it reliable for Fisher-LDA anchoring. The contrast is more principled than BiologicalOrganism (which includes only living things, missing rocks, water, etc.) and more direct than IntangibleAsset.
